channel.title: [562] Compiler
channel.description:
Im trying to compile my server and I cant find out why it keeps doing this, its not compiling but the compiler says....
favac: file not found: src\*.javac Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: [562] Compiler
item.dc:creator: @dds_ledg dds ledg
item.description:
@dds_ledg wrote:

BearrY:

But its not Compiling

Yeah, Right click on your Clients compiler and click edit. Then change the -sourcepath .src/*.javac to your where your java files are. So if you have a compiler inside the same folder as all your java files. change it to -sourcepath . *.javac

Read full topic

item.title: [562] Compiler
item.dc:creator: @BearrY BearrY
item.description:

item.title: [562] Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

for the love of god… I wish one of you new people would learn a bit about programming before deciding to jump in. Your error is beyond easy. There are no javac files, javac is the java compiling application. Right now it is searching for ever .javac file in your src directory, seeing as you have no .javac files its giving you an error(they are all .java files, if you haven’t caught on yet).

Read full topic
